dtliExcerpt: Leon is doing exceptional work here, corralling Davis’ penchant for long-winded metaphor and fast-paced metre, while also extracting hilarious performances from the entire ensemble, particularly Kara Young and Billy Eugene Jones. It’s a feat to be seen, felt, and enthralled by.

“There is nothing funny about the way racism has been codified into American systems of law, education, capitalism, etc. But shows like ‘Purlie Victorious’ work because they satirize the ludicrousness of these injustices and mock the partisans that continue to espouse them. The show should sit at the top of “must-see” lists for anyone who enjoys big-laugh comedies that take a piercing look at serious topics.”
